alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:42AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Alleghany, northwestern Surry, Wilkes, eastern Watauga, Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina and southwestern Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 615 AM EDT... At 542 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Scottville, or near Jefferson, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Sparta... Jefferson... West Jefferson... Ronda... and Lansing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
